data.title: Whatshapp Bengaluru
data.text:
Foxtrot Marathahalli Presents: DJ Shine

DJ Shine HVK SHINE HVK, also known as Harsha Vardhana Karibasavaiah, has been addicted to music ever since a young kid, so his interest went towards Djing. He stepped into Djing in the year 2006. As a teenager, his appreciation for music exposed him to a variety of music genres, this gradually became his passion.

At the time of him stepping into the DJ scene, Electronic music was making its mark and this provided him the platform to launch himself. Private parties & Club events were in great demand. SHINEHVK began playing small time events right next to professional Dj’s. A self motivated individual he honed his skills in Progressive house, Tech house, Techno, Trance, Hip-Hop, R&B, Pop & Retro amongst other genres. This allowed him to hone his skills and made him a better DJ. ‘WAR OF DJ’S’ in 2008 held at Bangalore Central was one of the most important moments in his career. This opened up many opportunities for him to perform alongside many celebrity DJ’s. Shine HVK has had a great track record for being the resident DJ for many renowned establishments in Bangalore, currently.

Freelancing, Shine HVK has performed for the IPL after parties and TCS World 10K marathon 2012 after party alongside DJ Clement, Offical DJ for Vodafone Cycling Marathon 2015 & TCS World 10k Marathon 2015.He has performed for the 75th Anniversary of KSCA (Karnataka State Cricket Association)

Friday | 10th August 2018 | 8:00 PM

Venue:

Foxtrot Gastropub,

2nd Floor, NTR Royal Plaza,

@Home Building, Marathahalli,

Outer Ring Road,

Bengaluru – 560037.

Free entry

Rate this:

Fandom & oaf. present Inthenow & STEVIE

Inthenow

Inthenow is an Indi-pop rock band that began in the year 2016 in Bangalore. After playing for 7years, the four musicians got together and Inthenow was born. Their name reveals the entire outlook on how they find themselves amidst the chaos of this world and wonderful experience they call life. Their music describes the struggles with themselves, each other, everything they care about and love.

Band Members

Aditya Ashwath – Guitars/Vocals,

Anirudh Ravi – Guitars/Vocals,

Himanshu Arora- Bass

Ashwin Alexander – Drums

Stevie

Stevie is a Chennai based Singer/Songwriter. The front man of Alt Rock outfit Nobody, Stevie has shared the stage with acts such as Junkyard Groove, RJD, Girish and the Chronicles, Final Surrender and Masala Coffee. Currently working on his debut EP, STEVIE as alive act promises to deliver power packed, energetic performances that are bound to get people on their feet. The music that STEVIE creates revolves around a concoction of acoustic pop, alt rock, R n B, trap, hip hop and ambient electronica from ideas that stem from his acoustic guitar. STEVIE also won the Best Young Indie Artist at the Radio City Freedom Awards- V.STEVIE.

Entry: Rs.300 + Rs.200 cover charge

Tickets available online: https://bit.ly/2AN622O

Thursday | 9th August 2018 | Gates open at 8:00 PM

Venue:

Fandom,

1st floor of Gilly’s Redefined,

# 413, 100 Feet Road, 4th Block,

Koramangala,

Bengaluru 560034.

Rate this:

Bangalore International Centre (A TERI Initiative) organizes a Panel discussion cum Abhinaya titled “Expressing the erotic – What Sringara Rasa means to Indian Dance”

Shringara or amorous love is considered to be the mother of all the nine rasas in Indian dance. It includes jealousy, passion anger, fear, lust and love. It is intimate and secret, yet universal. In this panel, two superb exponents of Indian dance will explore this nation of “amor” or amorous love. They will emote this feeling, demonstrate how it is used and displayed in Indian dance and give historical content that goes back to the Natyashastra. How do males experience shringara? This will be a fantastic exploration of the feeling that made poets swoon.

Panelists:

Madhu Nataraj.

Performer, Choreographer, Educator and Arts Entrepreneur.

Praveen Kumar.

Award Winning Dancer and Founder – Chithkala School of Dance.

Shoba Narayan.

Sutradhar, Rasika and Writer.

on Friday | 10th August | 2018 | 6.30 PM

Venue:

Bangalore International Centre,

TERI Complex,

4th Main, 2nd Cross,

Domlur II Stage,

Bangalore – 560 071.

Rate this:

Bangalore International Centre organizes “Searching Soma – Heritage Liquors of India” a Panel Discussion

Korea has soju; Japan has sake; America has bourbon; Mexico has tequila and mescal. What about India?

Indian tribes have been distilling spirits for longer than the Scots have. At a time when national spirit is high, shouldn’t we consider a signature spirit as well?

This panel will explore the origins, evolution and the future of Indian indigenous brews and spirits such as Tadi, Feni, Mahua, Handiya, Roksi, Apong and Kesar kasturi among many others. (Tasting not included)

Alcohol Alchemist Desmond Nazareth, Lost in the forest Anthropologist Rahul Srivastava, Desi Daru Pundit, Aniruddha (Jhampan Mookerjee) will be in conversation with Shoba Narayan – Questioning Spirit.

on Tuesday | 7th August 2018 | 6.30 PM

Venue:

Bangalore International Centre,

TERI Complex,

4th Main, 2nd Cross,

Domlur II Stage,

Bangalore – 560 071

Enquiry No. 98865 99675.

Rate this:

Floral Tribute to Indian Defence at Independence Day Flower Show 2018

Organized by Department of Horticulture and The Mysore Horticulture Society, Bengaluru.

Attractions of the Glass House.

Amar Jawan Jyothi, Floral tributes to the Indian Armed Forces, ISRO Satellite Launching Vehicle and War Missile models, HAL manufactured aeroplane models, A Sweet memory of the ‘Kannada Cinema – 85’ Floral model of a Lion, Vertical Garden around the Light House, English garden glaze to the Court yard, Flower Pyramids, Display panels on Indian Defence Forces.

Attractions outside the Glass House.

Mega Floral flow, Dancing Peacock, Heart-shaped Flower Arches, Beauty of Hanging Flowers, Huge Leaf Variety and Flower Pot Exhibition.

The Uniqueness in Selected Areas of Lalbagh.

Fruits and Vegetable Attraction, Plant fair for plant lovers, Exhibition of wood carving, Lalbagh Waterfalls.

Vehicle Parking:

Parking at

1. Multi storey car park at Shantinagar Bus Stand Complex,

2. Visitors from J.C Road can park at the BBMP multi storey car park near Mayura Restaurant, J.C Road,

3. Parking for two wheelers at Al-Ameen College grounds between Lalbagh Main gate and Double Road Entrance.

Special entry for school students.

Except on 5, 11, 12 and 15th August free entry for school students on 4, 6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 13 and 14th August 2018 from 9:00 AM to 5:00 PM. School buses and any other vehicles belonging to educational institutions should enter through Lalbagh Double Road entrance (Gate no 2) which can be parked near Dr.M.H Marigowda Memorial Hall and should exit through the same gate.

Entrance Fee (including GST)

Adults: Rs.70/-

Children Rs.20/-

Tickets available at the Venue.

208th Flower Show from 4th to 15th August 2018.

Venue:

Glass House,

Lalbagh,

Bengaluru.

Rate this:

“DJ Ivan” is one of Bangalore’s (India) foremost prime DJ, is unquestionably one of the pioneers of excellent music and entertainment today. Ivan’s versatility in various music genres has always created an ambience of taste, talent and celebration for all music lovers. It is DJ Ivan’s passion, originality & individuality that set him apart from the world. It is not only his music that stands in the foreground, but also the integration of strong words and images – always different and mystical, against the current and diverse in terms of “Style”. DJ Ivan’s talent isn’t confined to the decks, he is well known for his music acumen which has secured him the position of a notable DJ over the years.

DJ Ivan’s success burgeoned and was evident at the very early stages of his DJing career, making him immensely popular & favored in the scenes. His extensive knowledge of music & mixing has been the hallmark to set and changed the moods of people, ensuring non-stop fun at all parties.

He utilizes his vast knowledge of the scene and its music to help create parties that focus on diverse quality sounds and a welcoming, energetic vibe. DJ Ivan’s larger than life character has won him friends all over the world. Today, DJ Ivan’s outlook is to produce his own music and he wishes that this soon becomes a testament to quality control and a signpost of his long-term wider aims.

Past Forward on Saturday | 4th August 2018 | 9:30 PM

Venue:

1Q1 Kitchen & Bar,

No.1, Express Building,

Queens Road,

Bengaluru 560001

Entry free

Rate this:

Output presents Music by DJ Deep Bhamra

A part of the new breed of emerging DJs, Deep Bhamra A.K.A DJ Deep has been following his passion for music and honing his talents for quite some time now. It started with learning to play instruments at the age of 10, to understanding how music is made.

With a strong motivation, he got into DJing 8 years ago blinded by his love for electronic music.

As a DJ, he intuitively works a room with his creative mixing, playing quality music for the masses, as well as the most discriminating audiences. With a huge collection of tunes on hand covering a wide range of genres, Deep leaves trails of memories, melodies and stories wherever he goes.

After having performed and opened for recognisable DJs in the country, there’s a lot new he is gaining everyday further sharpening his skills technically and musically.

Saturday | 4th August 2018 | 8:30 PM

Venue:

Output

36/5, Soul Space Arena Mall,

4th floor, Outer ring road,

Doddanekunddi, Mahadevapura,

Bengaluru

Free entry.
